intro: Palicourea macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited palicourea, is a shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. Its fruits are fleshy, red berries that contain several seeds. Palicourea macrocarpa is often found in moist, shaded understories of tropical forests.
